unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26, 2023 - Unscheduled load shedding continues to plague several regions across North India, particularly Uttar Pradesh and Bihar, disrupting daily life and impacting businesses. The Northern Regional Load Despatch Centre (NRLDC) cited unforeseen maintenance at the Rihand Super Thermal Power Plant as a major contributing factor.
normalised: New Delhi, twenty sixth October two thousand and twenty three - Unscheduled load shedding continues to plague several regions across North India, particularly Uttar Pradesh and Bihar, disrupting daily life and impacting businesses. The N R L D C cited unforeseen maintenance at the Rihand Super Thermal Power Plant as a major contributing factor.

unnormalised: "Efforts are underway to restore full generation capacity," stated Dr. Sharma, spokesperson for the Ministry of Power. "We understand the inconvenience this causes, especially during the Diwali season."
normalised: "Efforts are underway to restore full generation capacity," stated Doctor Sharma, spokesperson for the Ministry of Power. "We understand the inconvenience this causes, especially during the Diwali season."

unnormalised: The outages, lasting between 2 to 4 hours in many areas, have affected small and medium enterprises, causing production delays and financial losses. Some shopkeepers in Lucknow reported losses of Rs. 5,000 per day due to the power cuts. Demand for inverters and generators has surged.
normalised: The outages, lasting between two to four hours in many areas, have affected small and medium enterprises, causing production delays and financial losses. Some shopkeepers in Lucknow reported losses of rupee five thousand per day due to the power cuts. Demand for inverters and generators has surged.

unnormalised: The state government has announced a compensation scheme for industries incurring significant losses due to the outages. Eligible businesses can apply for compensation up to Rs. 10,000 based on the area affected, typically measured in sq ft. Officials expect the situation to normalize by the end of the week.
normalised: The state government has announced a compensation scheme for industries incurring significant losses due to the outages. Eligible businesses can apply for compensation up to rupee ten thousand based on the area affected, typically measured in square feet. Officials expect the situation to normalize by the end of the week.
